== Ubuntu.com Site Structure ==

The Ubuntu website is divided into several portions. Currently they are:

* Homepage - a special page
* Products - describes the various Ubuntu products - urls begin with /products
* Get Ubuntu - enables users to download or buy ubuntu - urls begin with /getubuntu
* Support - tells users how to find help - urls begin with /support
* Community - describes the Ubuntu community - urls begin with /community
* Testing - information for Ubuntu testers - urls begin with /testing
* Partners - information for and about ISVs, distributors and OEMs - urls begin with /partners
* News - press releases and other related content - urls begin with /news
* Training - training related content - urls begin with /training
* About - content that doesn't really fit elsewhere - any url not matching other url prefixes

=== Related Sites ===

* The Ubuntu start page at http://start.ubuntu.com/_release_number/ - The web page people see when they first use Ubuntu
* Wiki at https://wiki.ubuntu.com - community provided and managed information
* Documentation at https://help.ubuntu.com and https://help.ubuntu.com/community
* Myriads of other sites managed by the individual teams that make up the Ubuntu community such as the forums, screen casts, brainstorm and loco teams.
